author: Michael Larabel
description: Given the significant gains to the Intel Arrow Lake performance on Linux since launch that I showcased last month on Phoronix, I was also eager to see how the Intel Lunar Lake performance has evolved since its debut last year. In this article is a look at those relatively weak launch-day Linux performance numbers for the Core Ultra 7 256V compared to where they are performing now on Ubuntu 25.04 for showing how far the Intel Lunar Lake performance has evolved since last September.
title: Intel Core Ultra 7 256V "Lunar Lake" Linux Performance In Mid-2025 vs. Launch Day

author: Michael Larabel
description: Rust 1.87 is now available as the newest version of this popular programming language. With the Rust 1.87 release it also marks ten years already of this system programming language focused on memory safety and modern features...
title: Rust Language Celebrates Ten Years By Releasing Rust 1.87

author: Michael Larabel
description: Adding to the excitement for this September's GNOME 49 release is introducing the Mutter SDK...
title: Mutter SDK Merged For GNOME 49

author: Michael Larabel
description: The beta release of the KDE Plasma 6.4 beta desktop is now available for testing ahead of its official release in June...
title: KDE Plasma 6.4 Beta Released With Aurorae & KWin-X11

author: Michael Larabel
description: For those that may be upgrading to the new Framework 13 with AMD Ryzen AI 300 series "Strix Point" SoCs and curious about hitting the best possible Linux performance, this article is for you. Here is a look at the performance of the Framework Laptop 13 with AMD Ryzen AI 9 HX 370 across CachyOS, Clear Linux, Debian, Fedora Workstation 42, Manjaro Linux 25.0, openSUSE Tumbleweed, and Ubuntu 25.04.
title: CachyOS, Clear Linux & Debian 13 Deliver The Best Performance On Framework Laptop 13 With AMD Strix Point

author: Michael Larabel
description: Posted last month were Linux patches for removing support for very old i486 and early i586 CPUs. While not yet mainlined to the Linux kernel contrary to some of the reporting elsewhere, this work for removing TSC-less and CX8-less x86 CPUs remains ongoing and out today is the second iteration of the patches...
title: Linux Patches Updated For Dropping Support For Very Old x86 CPUs

author: Michael Larabel
description: Archinstall 3.0.5 is now available as the latest update to this easy-to-use, text-based Arch Linux OS installer...
title: Arch Linux Installer Adds Labwc & Niri Wayland Compositor Options

author: Michael Larabel
description: Following recent discussions by Linux kernel developers around integrating swap cache and swap maps functionality with the swap allocator, Swap Table was born. With Swap Tables the hope is for lower memory use, higher performance, dynamic swap allocation and growth, greater extensibility, and other improvements over the existing swap code within the Linux kernel...
title: Linux Swap Table Code Shows The Potential For Huge Performance Gains

author: Michael Larabel
description: Released last week was the Vulkan 1.4.315 spec update and with it comes the new VK_EXT_zero_initialize_device_memory extension for allowing device memory allocations to be zero-initialized...
title: Vulkan 1.4.315 With VK_EXT_zero_initialize_device_memory For VKD3D-Proton & More

author: Michael Larabel
description: For those interested in making use of GPU-accelerated AV1 video decoding with Intel graphics hardware using the Vulkan Video API, some important fixes were merged to Mesa 25.2-devel and will presumably be backported soon to existing Mesa releases...
title: Intel ANV Driver Lands Fixes For AV1 Decoding With Vulkan Video

author: Michael Larabel
description: Llamafile continues pushing forward as the interesting Mozilla project to allow easily distributing and running AI large language models (LLMs) from a single file and in a cross-platform and cross-vendor hardware manner. Llamafile 0.9.3 is out today with more enhancements to this Mozilla Ocho project...
title: Llamafile 0.9.3 Brings Support For Qwen3 & Phi4

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Direct Rendering Manager (DRM) updates have been submitted for the Mediatek driver in advance of the upcoming Linux 6.16 merge window...
title: Mediatek DRM Driver Prepares For HDMI 2.0 With MT8195/MT8188
